p: Since the first outbreak of DF in 2004, Bhutan has reports of some sporadic cases and very few outbreaks [ 11]. Geographically, Bhutan is a mountainous country with most part of the country falling at an average height of 8000 ft above sea level. Nevertheless, incursion of tropical diseases into the low-lying areas in south have been noted in recent years [ 9, 11, 24]. As pointed out by studies, urbanization, globalization and lack of effective vector control, have probably contributed to the increasing epidemics of dengue and other tropical diseases in otherwise a low-risk country [ 10].
